description: This course is an introduction to bookmaking terms, techniques, and structures, typography, contemporary works, design foundations and book layout, as well as the reasons for practicing or challenging a conceptual approach to working in the book form. Students will learn a variety of structures and discover new ways of incorporating text and image by integrating letterpress, woodcut, linoleum and digital systems in an experimental context. Book Art is a time-based medium that challenges our contemporary concepts of reading and seeing, in a form that invites a unique and tactile intimacy with the viewer. These challenges demand that the artist strive for qualities that engage the senses, the imagination, and the intellect.
name: BOOK ARTS & LETTERPRESS
